sub_title: "We become stronger by voluntarily facing what impeded our necessary progress." - Dr. Jordan B. Peterson (Beyond Order: 12 More Rules for Life, 2021)
summary:
Paul was born and raised in Manila, Philippines and immigrated to California with his family in 2006. He attended Our Lady of the Miraculous Medal and St. John Bosco High School for his primary and secondary education, respectively. Paul then attended Saint John's University in Minnesota and graduated with the class of 2019. During his time as a Johnnie, he involved himself in many administrative and leadership roles as a Cadet in the Army ROTC Program; a Residential Assistant; a student ambassador; an international student ambassador; a disciplinary committee member; and a housing committee member.

Paul entered in the service as a Minnesota National Guard Soldier in 2016, serving in 1-194th Armor Regiment until his commissioning in the Spring of 2019. Immediately after his commissioning, he served as a Cadet Instructor in Fort Knox, KY before attending Armor Basic Officer Leadership Course in Fort Moore, GA. After completing ABOLC in the winter of 2019, he served as a Platoon Leader and a primary battalion staff member with the 2nd Battalion, 8th Cavalry Regiment in Fort Cavazos, TX until the winter of 2022. He then served as the Executive Officer of the Headquarters and Headquarters Company of 194th Armored Brigade in Fort Moore, GA until the winter of 2023.

Paul is currently attending the Army Maneuver Captain Career Course at Fort Moore, GA in preparation for his next assignment and is expected to graduate in the fall of 2023.

awards.title: Norwegian Military Marching Badge - Bronze
awards.description:
• CPT Paul Machete is awarded the bronze covered Military Marching Badge
• Place: Fort Moore, GA
• Date: 24MAY2023

awards.title: Army Commendation Medal
awards.description:
• 1LT Machete served as the Executive Officer for Headquarters and Headquarters Company, 194th AR BDE. During his tenure, 1LT Machete assisted in the integration of Holistic Health and Fitness model in the Brigade. His personal efforts enabled the training of over 3,000 Trainees for the Armor community and the development of Cadre who continuously provided the best training available. Lastly, he ensured two successful change of commands resulting in zero Financial Liability Investigation of Property Loss for the company.
• 1LT Machete's influence is evident by his work as the Headquarters and Headquarters Company Executive Officer. He created and implemented the first versions of the companies Arms Room and Supply SOP and developed a streamline process to resource everything necessary to execute all high-risk training throughout the 194th AR BDE. His exceptional leadership attributes are a testament to his dedication to service and commitment to Soldiers and their Families.
• 1LT Machete's dedication to duty, organizational leadership, and work ethic were unparalleled. He created and implemented a comprehensive resourcing program in Headquarters and Headquarters Company, resulting in resource requirements for training to always be met. 1LT Machete resourced and executed logistical support for over 3,000 Trainees and 50 ranges over the span of 12 months. 1LT Machete helped grow this organization far beyond what was expected of him.
• 1LT Machete's ability to maintain efficient lines of multi-echelon communication afforded the Commander and subordinate committees flexibility for last-minute changes as needed for meeting Higher Headquarters' difficult resourcing requirements. He developed needed systems for tracking resource utilization for the 194th AR BDE, such as the repair and maintenance of 11 vehicle displays throughout the BDE footprint, and the maintenance and improvement of the Kall River OSUT driving course.

awards.title: Army Commendation Medal
awards.description:
• 1LT Machete served as a critical member of the 2-8 CAV team for approximately 2 years. As a Tank Platoon Leader, he executed 2 crew gunneries, 1 section gunnery, 1 platoon live fire, 4 company live fires, 1 brigade certifying exercise, and 4 company deployments to countries outside of the Battalion (BN) forward operating site. During the BN rotation in support of Operation (OPN) Atlantic Resolve, and within 48 hours of arrival to the Pabrade Training Area, LT Machete ensured 4/4 Blue Platoon tanks completed live-fire accuracy and screening tests.
• While deployed in support of OPN Atlantic Resolve, 1LT Machete's platoon was the most critical to the success of the live fire during NATO OPN Crystal Arrow. In addition to the live fire portion, 1LT Machete was crucial to company success throughout the maneuver portion. In addition to resourcing training, 1LT Machete actively participated in training with his team including the BN Spur Ride.
• 1LT Machete served with distinction as a Company and Battalion Command Family Readiness Representative. Upon redeployment, he assumed the BN position and immediately started executing SFRG events, including a Trunk or Treat, Family and Friends Spur Ride, and Pot Luck. LT Machete also coordinated the BN outreach program for Troopers in need during the Thanksgiving and Holiday period. Approximately 30 Troopers were provided with gift baskets and supplies to enjoy these Holidays. He was instrumental re-establishing the STALLION SFRG program after the deployment.
• LT Machete's dedication to his company as the company Unit Movement Officer during Operation Atlantic Resolve was nothing short of extraordinary. He planned and resourced 3 company deployments crossing international borders with zero loss to 72 million dollars of equipment. He ensured that all combat platforms arrived on time, ready to support strategic-level training events which brought great credit to the brigade, division, as was the United States of America.

awards.title: Army Commendation Medal
awards.description:
• 1LT Machete was selected 1 out of 3 Platoon Leaders to lead a Platoon during Nato Operation Crystal Arrow 2021's multinational combined arms live-fire exercise (CALFEX). He demonstrated lethality by serving as the CALFEX ground force commander of a complex, sequenced assault force. His professionalism and dedication to duty allowed his unit to represent the United States of America in a powerful and professional manner, exhibiting the capabilities of the M1A2 SEP v2 Abrams alongside 7 other NATO allies.
• 1LT Machete displayed incredible tactical and technical proficiency, operating at a level above and beyond his experience. During the maneuver portion of OPN Crystal Arrow 2021, he and his Platoon were the company main effort on multiple occasions, resulting in 3rd Platoon notionally engaging and destroying an entire Mechanized Infantry Battalion within 60 minutes - consisting of enemy tanks, personnel carriers, trucks, strike teams with AT systems - adjudicated by Observer Controller/Trainers while never being engaged and destroyed by enemy direct fire.
• 1LT Machete led his platoon through 3 Company CALFEX operations during OPN Summer Shield, serving as the assault force on 2 CALFEXs. His platoon's aggressiveness was palpable by all who were present. He further demonstrated his leadership abilities and technical knowledge on his vehicle and weapons while simultaneously conducting interoperability operations as a representative of 2-8 CAV, 1-1 CD and the United States Army. His professional and personable character strengthened bonds between NATO allies.
• Due to 1LT Machete's attention to detail and commitment to excellence, A31 in Alpha Company was fully mission capable for the entirety of OPN Crystal Arrow and OPN Summer Shield. He molded his crew into a model of efficiency and competence that was emulated by fellow tank commanders. His implementation of an aggressive and thorough maintenance program for his tank section ensured his crew were mission capable.

awards.title: Rotation Forces-Lithuania Medal
awards.issuer: Lt Gen Valdemaras Rupsys, Chief of Defence of the Republic of Lithuania

awards.title: Army Achievement Medal
awards.description: • 1LT Machete achieved a score of 915/1000 points and 9/10 during Table XII of Stallion Gunnery. This score qualifies him and his crew as distinguished, proving their lethality on a Tank platform.

awards.title: Certificate of Achievement
awards.description: For meritorious achievement while competing the Recruiting & Retention Battalion, Recruit Sustainment Program FY17 Operation Future Warrior (OFW) Best Warrior Challenge. The Warrior Challenge is a test of both mental and physical challenges. The dedication and determination to excel is evident in your achievement as Best Warrior Challenge Detachment. While participating you competed in such tasks as navigating through an intense obstacle course, conducting an army physical fitness test, tactical road march, and dismounted land navigation. Your actions are in keeping with the finest traditions of military service and reflect distinct credit upon yourself, the Recruiting & Retention Battalion, the Recruit Sustainment Program, and the Minnesota National Guard. Thank you for participating and making OFW a great success. With the admiration and respect of the Recruiting & Retention Battalion Commander and the Raptor Soldiers.

awards.title: Certificate of Recognition
awards.description:
State of California Senate
2015 Philippine Society of Southeast Los Angeles Scholarship Recipient
In honor of your exemplary work and excellence in academics and service to the Filipino-American community. Congratulations on receiving the 2015 Scholarship Award from the Philippine Society of Southeast Los Angeles. Best wishes for continued success.

awards.title: Certificate of Recognition
awards.description:
California Legislature Assembly
On behalf of the 58th Assembly District, I congratulate you on being the recipient of the Philippine Society of Southeast Los Angeles Scholarship. As you continue on your path of success, your steadfast dedication and commitment to academic achievement will guide you toward a rewarding, fruitful future. You are a bright presence in our community and an exemplary role model to others. I wish you nothing but the success in your future endeavors. Continue to be great!

awards.title: Certificate of Special Congressional Recognition
awards.description:
Congress of the United States
House of Representatives
In honor and recognition of your academic achievement.

awards.title: The National Society of High School Scholars Membership
awards.description: In recognition of academic achievement and excellence, has been granted membership in The National Society of High School Scholars and is hereby awarded all rights, honors, and privileges thereunto appertaining. This membership is for meritorious scholastic achievement and the pursuit of excellence at St. John Bosco High School.

company.name: United States Department of the Army

profile_positions.description:
• Served in Headquarters & Headquarters Company "Hardchargers", 194th Armored Brigade as the HHC BDE Executive Officer.
• Responsible for supporting training for all Cavalry and Armor Trainees.
• Responsible for the accountability and maintenance of the Company's equipment and vehicles.
• Responsible for the training, readiness, logistical support, discipline, health and welfare, and professional development of their Officers and Non-Commissioned Officers.
• Maintains a high level of readiness through training, a thorough maintenance program, an accountable Command Supply Discipline program, and enforcement of Army standards.
• Advices the Commander on all matters of tactical sustainment and maintenance readiness.
• Assumes command of the Company in the absence of the Commander.
profile_positions.title: Company Executive Officer

profile_positions.description: • Served in 2nd Cavalry Battalion, 8th Regiment "Stallions" as Battalion Primary Staff in charge of Family and Soldier readiness
profile_positions.title: Battalion Family Readiness Representative

profile_positions.description:
• Served in 3rd Platoon "Heathens" as BLUE 1 in Animal Company, 2nd Cavalry Battalion, 8th Regiment, 1st Armored Brigade Combat Team
• Additional duties included Unit Movement Officer, Arms Room Officer, Family Readiness Liaison
• Deployed to Europe Command in support of Atlantic Resolve from November 2020 to July 2021.
profile_positions.title: Platoon Leader

profile_positions.description: • Served as a Cadet Instructor, supervising training and evaluation of cadets through ROTC Advanced Camp
profile_positions.title: Cadet Instructor

profile_positions.description:

• Enrolled in as a Simultaneous Membership Program (SMP) Cadet
profile_positions.title: Command Team Member

profile_positions.description:
• Reside and be present on the floor to assist the community, including routine and extraordinary maintenance and emergencies.
• Perform those duties assigned by the Residential Life & Housing Office including, but not limited to, processing room condition reports and room leases, check-out procedures, as well as carrying out regular tasks relevant to assessing the condition of the room and achieving compliance with the housing lease agreement.
• Maintain discipline and order on the floor by working collaboratively and sharing responsibilities with the other RAs & Faculty Residents of the community.
• Develop a community that promotes a healthy living environment and encourages respect for individuals and property.
• Be firm when necessary, in encouraging residents to be accountable for their behavior by intiating appropriate disciplinary action in coordination with the Faculty Resident.
• Monitor the condition of Life Safety equipment on the floor on a monthly basis and report any needs to Life Safety Services.
Support the work of the custodial staff by attending to the cleanliness and upkeep of the building or floor.
• Distribute regular and special communications when requested by University departments and programs.
• Maintain and secure the lounges and lounge furniture as well as computer clusters.
profile_positions.title: Resident Assistant
